topic: How to profile event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to profile event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Profiling Event-Driven Systems Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a step-by-step guide on how to profile the performance of event-driven systems built with FastAPI, utilizing the features and improvements of Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand the importance of profiling for optimizing event-driven systems
Explore FastAPI's built-in performance monitoring capabilities
Discover third-party libraries to further enhance profiling capabilities
Learn how to interpret and act upon profiling results
Dive into Python 3.12+ improvements that benefit event-driven systems

code_examples.code:
import cProfile
profiler = cProfile.Profile()
profiler.run('main()')
profiler.print_stats(sort=sorted)

version_notes: Python 3.12+: Introduces performance improvements like faster start-up times, improved type hints support, and more efficient memory usage
FastAPI v0.74.0+: Added built-in profiling capabilities
caveats: Profiling may slow down your application, so use it judiciously during development
Ensure to understand the impact of profiling on your specific event-driven system
